Articles.Content: Post relevent pc specs, ie CPU, GPU, OS and if this is a new issue and weather or not it hasn't crashed before. I'll try and help.

start by looking in the Support Forum "How to" is not the place for such things.

there are several quick fixes that may help listed in the various stickied threads there. first off make sure you have the ksp folder in a "non windows" folder IE: not in users (including desktop) or any other windows created folders. dont know about program files, but mine is in the first level of the drive.

once you have done all the tips in those stickied threads, then post the problem in detail, give your specs (preferably a dxdiag) and hope its a solveable issue!

Its to do with ram, i had this problem when i had two and then 3 gigs of ram, it's to do with loading certain textures before deleting others overflowing your ram. how i fixed it was turn the terrain render to fastest, if that doesn't work just keep on turning the settings sown (starting with terrain settings) until it stops crashing

I have a startup issue and the inexplicable fix is focus. KSP MUST have window focus at the moment it switches from the fadeout of the Squad logo to the loading screen (art of Bob, Jeb and Bill). If it doesn't, it crashes without exception. If it does, I have no problems. In other words, as long as I'm not tabbed out when the load bar appears, I'm cool. You can then tab out to other windows while it loads, or even for a few seconds while the Squad logo fades in and out.

Yeah I get this too, I think it's just the game using a lot of power to get everything importing so if your not focused on that screen then the RAM will be somewhat used more I think.

same, i never really figured that was a bug though i suppose it is.
